TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DataBoundControl extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls that display their data in list or tabular form.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class is the base class used for ASP.NET controls that retrieve tabular or list-style data from an ASP.NET data source control and bind user-interface (UI) elements of the control to that data for display. Composite data-bound controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>; list-style data-bound controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>; and other controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl>.
Page developers do not use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class directly; instead, they use controls that derive from this class.
Control developers extend this class to create data-bound controls that work with classes that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> interface and classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceControl> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> classes. When deriving a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class, override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method to bind the UI elements of your control to data retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method. In most cases, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is the only method you will override in your derived class.
For ASP.NET 2.0 data-bound controls, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method is the equivalent of the `DataBind` method, and is called to bind data at run time. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to derive a class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class to create a custom data-bound control. The `TextBoxSet` control creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control for each data item retrieved from its associated data source control, and binds to the value of the data item at run time. The current implementation of the `Render` method renders the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> controls as an unordered list.
[!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxset.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxset.vb#2)]
The following code example demonstrates how to use the `TextBoxSet` control, defined in the previous example, and bind it to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource> control.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxsetcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxsetvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.
Occurs when data methods are being called.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The purpose of this event is to give you an opportunity to specify that the data methods to be called are on a different object than the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments CreateDataSourceSelectArguments() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a default object used by the data-bound control if no arguments are specified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.CreateDataSourceSelectArguments%2A> method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.SelectArguments%2A> property to initialize a default arguments object, and by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class's implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.CreateDataSourceSelectArguments%2A> method can be used in a derived class to retrieve a default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object.
[!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxset.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxset.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Occurs when the object is being created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The purpose of this event is to give you an opportunity to change the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSourceView> instance in scenarios where you want to use a custom class that derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelDataSourceView> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DataMember { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the list of data that the data-bound control binds to, in cases where the data source contains more than one distinct list of data items.
Docs.value: The name of the specific list of data that the data-bound control binds to, if more than one list is supplied by a data source control. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.DataMember%2A> property is stored in view state.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).

MemberSignature.Value: public override string DataSourceID { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the control from which the data-bound control retrieves its list of data items.
Docs.value: The ID of a control that represents the data source from which the data-bound control retrieves its data.

Docs.summary: Gets an object that implements the interface, which provides access to the object's data content.
Docs.value: An object with access to its data content.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.DataSourceView GetData() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves a object that the data-bound control uses to perform data operations.
Docs.returns: The that the data-bound control uses to perform data operations. If the property is set, a specific, named is returned; otherwise, the default is returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method retrieves a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> object from the associated data source control by calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetDataSource%2A> method. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property is used to identify a data source, a default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> object is created.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method is called to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView> object from the associated data source control and the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%2A> method is called to retrieve the data. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class.
[!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxset.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxset.vb#3)]

Docs.exception:
Both the and properties are set.
\- or -
The property is set but a object by that name does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.IDataSource GetDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the interface that the data-bound control is associated with, if any.
Docs.returns: An that represents the data source identified by .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetDataSource%2A> method internally. A valid <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource> instance is retrieved by these two methods and is cached by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> object until the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataPropertyChanged%2A> method signals that the data source has changed.

Docs.exception:
The control identified by the property does not exist in the current container.
\- or -
The control identified by the property does not implement the interface.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether model binding is in use.
Docs.value: if model binding is in use; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ItemType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data item type for strongly typed data binding.
Docs.value: The name of the model type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property enables the `Item` and `BindItem` data-binding expressions.
Setting this method automatically enables Dynamic Data functionality.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void LoadViewState(object savedState) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that represents the view state to restore.
Docs.summary: Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void MarkAsDataBound() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the state of the control in view state as successfully bound to data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data-bound control maintains a value in view state that indicates whether it is currently bound to data. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.MarkAsDataBound%2A> method sets the value to `true`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.MarkAsDataBound%2A> method is used by a derived data-bound control class. After data is retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method and bound to the control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.MarkAsDataBound%2A> method is called to signal that the control has completed binding and no longer requires it during the current page's life cycle. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class.
[!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxset.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxset.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Raises the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnDataPropertyChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Rebinds the data-bound control to its data after one of the base data source identification properties changes.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnDataSourceViewChanged (object sender, EventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDataSourceViewChanged(object sender, class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: The source of the event, the .
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataSourceViewChanged%2A> method notifies a data-bound control that the underlying data source has changed and that the control should rebind and any necessary work should be performed. Typically, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataSourceViewChanged%2A> method is called when a property of the data source view has changed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true` when it raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.DataSourceViewChanged> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnDataSourceViewChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void OnLoad(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Handles the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.ConfirmInitState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to set the initialized state of the data-bound control and sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A> property to `true` if the HTTP request is not a postback.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void OnPagePreLoad (object sender, EventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnPagePreLoad(object sender, class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Sets the initialized state of the data-bound control before the control is loaded.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.OnPagePreLoad%2A> method is overridden by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.RequiresDataBinding%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true` in cases where the HTTP request is a postback and view state is enabled but the data-bound control has not yet been bound. This scenario is common with controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView>, where the visibility of the control is changed at run time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void PerformDataBinding(class System.Collections.IEnumerable data) cil managed

Docs.param: The list of data returned from a method call.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, binds data from the data source to the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implement this method instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A> method when you derive a data-bound control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class. Placing your control's data-binding logic in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> enables you to avoid the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBinding> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBound> events being raised in the wrong order.
While the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class provides no specific implementation for this method, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method to bind the values of any user interface (UI) controls to the data that is retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method in a class derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl>. The `TextBoxSet` control creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control for each data item it is bound to. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class.
[!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxset.cs#5)] [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxset.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PerformSelect() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves data from the associated data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is called after data is retrieved to bind data to elements of the data-bound control. Derived types override this method to retrieve data only if the default implementation is not adequate. Typically, it is sufficient to provide a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback> delegate that performs any custom data work, rather than implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method to retrieve data from an associated data source using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.GetData%2A> method and bind it to the elements of the control. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class.
[!code-csharp[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/CS/textboxset.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Samples.AspNet.TextBoxSet/VB/textboxset.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves any view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
Docs.returns: The control's current view state. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns .

Docs.summary: Gets a object that the data-bound control uses when retrieving data from a data source control.
Docs.value: A value used by the data-bound control to retrieve data. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.SelectArguments%2A> property calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.CreateDataSourceSelectArguments%2A> method to create a default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string SelectMethod { get; set; }

Docs.summary: The name of the method to call in order to read data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property causes model binding to be used as the data-binding method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes view-state changes to the control to be tracked so they can be stored in the control's object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ValidateDataSource(object dataSource) cil managed

Docs.param: An object set to the property.
Docs.summary: Verifies that the object a data-bound control binds to is one it can work with.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.ValidateDataSource%2A> method is only called in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl> class's mutator (`set` accessor) for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class checks the type of the object that is set for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property to ensure that it is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, or <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.

Docs.exception: The object passed by the parameter is not or a recognized type.
